field.label: Customer Alias Management
field.comment: You can allow the customers to manage/delete their aliases in the their account.

field.label: Await Notification
field.comment: In some cases it may take a few seconds until the transaction is successfully authorized. When this option is enabled, the notification is awaited.

field.label: External Checkout: Guest Checkout
field.comment: When using an external checkout, the customer can either be asked to chose an option to authenticate (as guest, register or login) or he can always be checked out as guest. For the second option to work, guest checkout has to be enabled in magento.

field.label: Operation Mode
field.comment: If the test mode is selected the test PSPID is used and the test SHA passphrases.

field.label: Live PSPID
field.comment: The PSPID as given by the Barclaycard.

field.label: Test PSPID
field.comment: The test PSPID as given by the Barclaycard.

field.label: SHA-IN Passphrase
field.comment: Enter the live SHA-IN passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

field.label: SHA-OUT Passphrase
field.comment: Enter the live SHA-OUT passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

field.label: Test Account SHA-IN Passphrase
field.comment: Enter the test SHA-IN passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

field.label: Test Account SHA-OUT Passphrase
field.comment: Enter the test SHA-OUT passphrase. This value must be identical to the one in the back-end of Barclaycard.

field.label: Hash calculation method
field.comment: Select the hash calculation method to use. This value must correspond with the selected value in the back-end of Barclaycard.

field.label: Order prefix
field.comment: Here you can insert an order prefix. The prefix allows you to change the order number that is transmitted to Barclaycard. The prefix must contain the tag {id}. It will then be replaced by the order number (e.g. name_{id}).

field.label: Payment Page Title
field.comment: Define here the title which is shown on the payment page. If no title is defined here the default one is used.

field.label: Order Description
field.comment: This parameter is sometimes transmitted to the acquirer (depending on the acquirer), in order to be shown on the account statements of the merchant or the customer. The prefix can contain the tag {id}. It will then be replaced by the order number (e.g. name {id}). (Payment Page only)

field.label: Dynamic Template
field.comment: With the Dynamic Template you can design the layout of the payment page yourself. For the option 'Own template' the URL to the template file must be entered into the following box.

field.label: Template URL for own template
field.comment: The URL indicated here is rendered as Template. For this you must select option 'Use own template'. The URL must point to an HTML page that contains the string '$$$PAYMENT ZONE$$$'. This part of the HTML file is replaced with the form for the credit card input.

field.label: Shop ID
field.comment: Here you can define a Shop ID. This is only necessary if you wish to operate several shops with one PSPID. In order to use this module, an additional module is required.

field.label: API Username
field.comment: You can create an API username in the back-end of Barclaycard. The API user is necessary for the direct communication between the shop and the service of Barclaycard.

field.label: API Password
field.comment: Password for the API user.

field.label: Intended purpose of alias
field.comment: If the Alias Manager is used, the intended purpose is shown to the customer on the payment page. Through this the customer knows why his data is saved.

field.label: Transaction Updates
field.comment: When the store is not available (network outage, server failure or any other outage), when the feedback of Barclaycard is sent, then the transaction state is not updated. Hence no order confirmation e-mail is sent and the order is not in the paid state. By activating the transaction update, such transactions can be authorized later over direct link. To use this feature the update service must be activated and the API username and the API password must be set.

field.label: Level
field.comment: Messages of this or a higher level will be logged.

field.label: Show Payment Id
field.comment: Show the payment id in the order information

field.label: Use Base Currency
field.comment: Send amounts to Barclaycard in store's base currency.

field.label: Invoice Settlement
field.comment: Choose settlement after order in case you want an invoice to be created with your oder. The state of the invoice will set according to your capture status.

field.label: Send Invoice Email
field.comment: Send the invoice email automatically after invoice creation.

field.label: Capturing
field.comment: Should the amount be captured automatically after the order (direct) or should the amount only be reserved (deferred)?

field.label: Refused Transaction Threshold
field.comment: A typical pattern of a fraud transaction is a series of refused transaction before one of them is accepted. This setting defines the threshold after any following transaction is marked as uncertain. E.g. a threshold of three will mark any successful transaction after three refused transaction as uncertain.

field.label: 3D Secure
field.comment: With this setting you can disable a 3D secure check for this payment method. This setting only takes effect with Ajax Authorization (Flex Checkout) or Hidden Authorization (Alias Gateway).

field.label: Non 3D Secure Behavior
field.comment: Some cards are not enrolled for the 3D secure process and you may exclude some cards from performing a 3D secure authorization. This setting controls, what should happend with these transactions. This setting requires that the parameter 'CCCTY' is returned.

field.label: Non 3D Secure Behavior Country List
field.comment: The countries listed in this field are used to mark transaction as uncertain. The behavior depends on the setting above 'Non 3D Secure Behavior'. The country code is taken from the card. You need to make sure you return the parameter 'CCCTY'. As indicated by Barclaycard this value is only for 94% of the transaction correct. The list below must be a comma separated list of country codes. The codes must be in ISO 3166-2 format (e.g. DE,IT,FR).

field.label: Country Check
field.comment: The module can perform a check of the country code provided by the issuer of the card, the IP address country and the billing address country. In case they do not match, the transaction is marked as uncertain. This setting does not override any other rule for marking transaction as uncertain.

field.label: Authorization Method
field.comment: Select the authorization method to use for processing this payment method.

field.label: Alias Manager
field.comment: The alias manager allows the customer to select from a credit card previously stored. The sensitive data is stored by Barclaycard.

field.label: Show Payment Id
field.comment: Show the payment id in the order information

field.label: Use Base Currency
field.comment: Send amounts to Barclaycard in store's base currency.

field.label: Invoice Settlement
field.comment: Choose settlement after order in case you want an invoice to be created with your oder. The state of the invoice will set according to your capture status.

field.label: Send Invoice Email
field.comment: Send the invoice email automatically after invoice creation.

field.label: Capturing
field.comment: Should the amount be captured automatically after the order (direct) or should the amount only be reserved (deferred)?

field.label: Refused Transaction Threshold
field.comment: A typical pattern of a fraud transaction is a series of refused transaction before one of them is accepted. This setting defines the threshold after any following transaction is marked as uncertain. E.g. a threshold of three will mark any successful transaction after three refused transaction as uncertain.

field.label: Authorization Method
field.comment: Select the authorization method to use for processing this payment method.

field.label: Show Payment Id
field.comment: Show the payment id in the order information

field.label: Use Base Currency
field.comment: Send amounts to Barclaycard in store's base currency.

field.label: Invoice Settlement
field.comment: Choose settlement after order in case you want an invoice to be created with your oder. The state of the invoice will set according to your capture status.

field.label: Send Invoice Email
field.comment: Send the invoice email automatically after invoice creation.

field.label: Capturing
field.comment: Should the amount be captured automatically after the order (direct) or should the amount only be reserved (deferred)?

field.label: Payment Method Listing
field.comment: In case the payment page is used with this payment method the different credit card brands are listed on the payment page of Barclaycard. This setting controlls the display of them.

field.label: Credit Card Brands
field.comment: In case hidden authorization is used, the brand of the credit card is detected by the card number and the card number is validated accordingly. This setting enables the restriction of the allowed brands.

field.label: 3D Secure
field.comment: With this setting you can disable a 3D secure check for this payment method. This setting only takes effect with Ajax Authorization (Flex Checkout) or Hidden Authorization (Alias Gateway).

field.label: Refused Transaction Threshold
field.comment: A typical pattern of a fraud transaction is a series of refused transaction before one of them is accepted. This setting defines the threshold after any following transaction is marked as uncertain. E.g. a threshold of three will mark any successful transaction after three refused transaction as uncertain.

field.label: Non 3D Secure Behavior
field.comment: Some cards are not enrolled for the 3D secure process and you may exclude some cards from performing a 3D secure authorization. This setting controls, what should happend with these transactions. This setting requires that the parameter 'CCCTY' is returned.

field.label: Non 3D Secure Behavior Country List
field.comment: The countries listed in this field are used to mark transaction as uncertain. The behavior depends on the setting above 'Non 3D Secure Behavior'. The country code is taken from the card. You need to make sure you return the parameter 'CCCTY'. As indicated by Barclaycard this value is only for 94% of the transaction correct. The list below must be a comma separated list of country codes. The codes must be in ISO 3166-2 format (e.g. DE,IT,FR).

field.label: Country Check
field.comment: The module can perform a check of the country code provided by the issuer of the card, the IP address country and the billing address country. In case they do not match, the transaction is marked as uncertain. This setting does not override any other rule for marking transaction as uncertain.

field.label: Authorization Method
field.comment: Select the authorization method to use for processing this payment method.

field.comment: The alias manager allows the customer to select from a credit card previously stored. The sensitive data is stored by Barclaycard.
